DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: DWC sample checklist
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: DWC sample checklist
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Minimum information required for Darwin Core (DwC) samples

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the study if referring to Example: A7F9B3X2

FIELD.LABEL: Sample ID
FIELD.NAME: sample_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sample. Example: sample123

FIELD.LABEL: Scientific Name
FIELD.NAME: scientificName
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the species studied. Example: Arenicola marina

FIELD.LABEL: Organism
FIELD.NAME: organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the species studied. Example: Arenicola marina

FIELD.LABEL: Tissue
FIELD.NAME: tissue
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of tissue sampled for the study. Example: Leaf

FIELD.LABEL: Preparations
FIELD.NAME: preparations
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of how the sample was preserved. Example: Fresh

FIELD.LABEL: Event Date
FIELD.NAME: eventDate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date when the sample was collected with year, month and day specified in the format, YYYY-MM-DD. Example: 2024-09-20 00:00:00

FIELD.LABEL: Decimal Latitude
FIELD.NAME: decimalLatitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. Locations should be specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places. Example: 52.2053

FIELD.LABEL: Decimal Longitude
FIELD.NAME: decimalLongitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The longitude of the sample collection site, in decimal degrees. Example: 0.1218

FIELD.LABEL: Medium
FIELD.NAME: medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The material or physical carrier of the resource. Example: Tissue culture

FIELD.LABEL: Cultivar
FIELD.NAME: cultivar
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A plant variety that has been selectively bred and maintained through cultivation to have specific desirable traits, such as yield, resistance to disease, or appearance. Example: cv. Paragon

FIELD.LABEL: Material Source ID
FIELD.NAME: materialSourceID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The code used to identify the biological germplasm, strain, cell line or other source material. Useful for reordering material. Example: JIC GRU WM0013

FIELD.LABEL: Accession Number
FIELD.NAME: accession_number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study related to NCBI Taxonomy. Example: accession123

FIELD.LABEL: Class
FIELD.NAME: class
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the class in which the dwc:Taxon is classified. Example: Hepaticopsida

FIELD.LABEL: Collection Code
FIELD.NAME: collectionCode
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name, acronym, code, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived. Example: Hildebrandt

FIELD.LABEL: Collection ID
FIELD.NAME: collectionID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for the collection or dataset from which the record was derived. Example: https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll/collection/fbd3ed74-5a21-4e01-b86a-33d36f032d9c

FIELD.LABEL: Continent
FIELD.NAME: continent
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the continent in which the dcterms:Location occurs. Example: Europe

FIELD.LABEL: Country Code
FIELD.NAME: countryCode
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The standard code for the country in which the dcterms:Location occurs. Example: AR

FIELD.LABEL: County
FIELD.NAME: county
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs. Example: Los Lagos

FIELD.LABEL: Cultivar Epithet
FIELD.NAME: cultivarEpithet
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Part of the name of a cultivar, cultivar group or grex that follows the dwc:scientificName. Example: King Edward

FIELD.LABEL: Dataset ID
FIELD.NAME: datasetID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution. Example: b15d4952-7d20-46f1-8a3e-556a512b04c5

FIELD.LABEL: Dataset Name
FIELD.NAME: datasetName
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived. Example: Grinnell Resurvey Mammals

FIELD.LABEL: Date Identified
FIELD.NAME: dateIdentified
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the dwc:Taxon. Example: 1963-03-08T14:07

FIELD.LABEL: Disposition
FIELD.NAME: disposition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The current state of a specimen with respect to the collection identified in dwc:collectionCode or dwc:collectionID. Example: Used up

FIELD.LABEL: Infraspecific Epithet
FIELD.NAME: infraspecificEpithet
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the dwc:scientificName, excluding any rank designation. Example: concolor

FIELD.LABEL: Institution ID
FIELD.NAME: institutionID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record. Example: https: //ror.org/015hz7p22

FIELD.LABEL: Island
FIELD.NAME: island
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the island on or near which the dcterms:Location occurs. Example: Zanzibar

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: Island Group
FIELD.NAME: islandGroup
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the island group in which the dcterms:Location occurs. Example: Alexander Archipelago

FIELD.LABEL: Kingdom
FIELD.NAME: kingdom
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the dwc:Taxon is classified. Example: Animalia

FIELD.LABEL: Language
FIELD.NAME: language
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A language of the resource. Example: en

FIELD.LABEL: Locality
FIELD.NAME: locality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The specific description of the place. Example: Queets Rainforest, Olympic National Park

FIELD.LABEL: Location According To
FIELD.NAME: locationAccordingTo
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the source of this dcterms:Location information. Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution, or team of individuals. Example: Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names

FIELD.LABEL: Location ID
FIELD.NAME: locationID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for the set of dcterms:Location information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set. Example: https://opencontext.org/subjects/768A875F-E205-4D0B-DE55-BAB7598D0FD1

FIELD.LABEL: Location Remarks
FIELD.NAME: locationRemarks
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Comments or notes about the dcterms:Location. Example: under water since 2005

FIELD.LABEL: Material Entity Remarks
FIELD.NAME: materialEntityRemarks
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Comments or notes about the dwc:MaterialEntity instance. Example: found in association with charred remains

FIELD.LABEL: Maximum Depth In Metres
FIELD.NAME: maximumDepthInMeters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in metres. Example: 200

FIELD.LABEL: Maximum Distance Above Surface In Metres
FIELD.NAME: maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation. Example: -1.5

FIELD.LABEL: Maximum Elevation In Metres
FIELD.NAME: maximumElevationInMeters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in metres. Example: 1236

FIELD.LABEL: Minimum Depth In Metres
FIELD.NAME: minimumDepthInMeters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in metres. Example: 100

FIELD.LABEL: Minimum Distance Above Surface In Metres
FIELD.NAME: minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation. Example: 4.2

FIELD.LABEL: Minimum Elevation In Metres
FIELD.NAME: minimumElevationInMeters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in metres Example: -100

FIELD.LABEL: Organism ID
FIELD.NAME: organismID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for the dwc:Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set. Example: organism123

FIELD.LABEL: Organism Quantity
FIELD.NAME: organismQuantity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of dwc:Organisms. Example: 27

FIELD.LABEL: Organism Quantity Type
FIELD.NAME: organismQuantityType
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms. Example: 12.5

FIELD.LABEL: Organism Remarks
FIELD.NAME: organismRemarks
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Comments or notes about the dwc:Organism instance. Example: One of a litter of six

FIELD.LABEL: Phylum
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the dwc:Taxon is classified. Example: Chordata

FIELD.LABEL: Recorded By
FIELD.NAME: recordedBy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A person, group, or organization responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence. Example: José E. Crespo

FIELD.LABEL: Recorded By ID
FIELD.NAME: recordedByID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifier for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence. Example: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098

FIELD.LABEL: Reproductive Condition
FIELD.NAME: reproductiveCondition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the dwc:Occurrence. Example: Fruit-bearing

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Size Unit
FIELD.NAME: sampleSizeUnit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling dwc:Event. Example: minute

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Size Value
FIELD.NAME: sampleSizeValue
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling dwc:Event. Example: 5

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Effort
FIELD.NAME: samplingEffort
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The amount of effort expended during a dwc:Event. Example: 40 trap-nights

FIELD.LABEL: Sampling Protocol
FIELD.NAME: samplingProtocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The methods or protocols used during a dwc:Event, denoted by an IRI. Example: UV light trap

FIELD.LABEL: Specific Epithet
FIELD.NAME: specificEpithet
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the first or species epithet of the dwc:scientificName. Example: concolor

FIELD.LABEL: Subfamily
FIELD.NAME: subfamily
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the subfamily in which the dwc:Taxon is classified. Example: Periptyctinae

FIELD.LABEL: Subgenus
FIELD.NAME: subgenus
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the dwc:Taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion. Example: Strobus

FIELD.LABEL: Taxon Concept ID
FIELD.NAME: taxonConceptID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a dwc:Taxon. Example: 8fa58e08-08de-4ac1-b69c-1235340b7001

FIELD.LABEL: Taxon Remarks
FIELD.NAME: taxonRemarks
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Comments or notes about the taxon or name. Example: this name is a misspelling in common use

FIELD.LABEL: Taxonomic Status
FIELD.NAME: taxonomicStatus
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The status of the use of the dwc:scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a dwc:Taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the experts opinion. It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that defines the concept. Example: misapplied

FIELD.LABEL: Type
FIELD.NAME: type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The nature or genre of the resource. Example: StillImage

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Coordinate System
FIELD.NAME: verbatimCoordinateSystem
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The spatial coordinate system for the dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude or the dwc:verbatimCoordinates of the dcterms:Location. Example: decimal degrees

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Coordinates
FIELD.NAME: verbatimCoordinates
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the dcterms:Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem. Example: 41 05 54S 121 05 34W

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Depth
FIELD.NAME: verbatimDepth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The original description of the depth below the local surface. Example: 100-200

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Elevation
FIELD.NAME: verbatimElevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location. Example: 100-200

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Event Date
FIELD.NAME: verbatimEventDate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for a dwc:Event. Example: spring 1910

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Identification
FIELD.NAME: verbatimIdentification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record. Example: Peromyscus sp.

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Label
FIELD.NAME: verbatimLabel
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The content of this term should include no embellishments, prefixes, headers or other additions made to the text. Abbreviations must not be expanded and supposed misspellings must not be corrected. Lines or breakpoints between blocks of text that could be verified by seeing the original labels or images of them may be used. Examples of material entities include preserved specimens, fossil specimens, and material samples. Best practice is to use UTF-8 for all characters. Best practice is to add comment ‚ÄúverbatimLabel derived from human transcription‚Äù in dwc:occurrenceRemarks. Example: Monotoma longicollis 4 ♂ Det TC McElrath 2018

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Latitude
FIELD.NAME: verbatimLatitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The verbatim original latitude of the dcterms:Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem. Example: 41 05 54.03S

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Locationality
FIELD.NAME: verbatimLocality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The original textual description of the place. Example: 25 km NNE Bariloche por R. Nac. 237

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Longitude
FIELD.NAME: verbatimLongitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The verbatim original longitude of the dcterms:Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem. Example: 121d 10' 34" W

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim SRS
FIELD.NAME: verbatimSRS
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude, or dwc:verbatimCoordinates are based. Example: WGS84

FIELD.LABEL: Verbatim Taxon Rank
FIELD.NAME: verbatimTaxonRank
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the dwc:scientificName as it appears in the original record. Example: prole

FIELD.LABEL: Vernacular Name
FIELD.NAME: vernacularName
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A common or vernacular name. Example: Andean Condor

FIELD.LABEL: Vertical Datum
FIELD.NAME: verticalDatum
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based. Example: EGM84

FIELD.LABEL: Vitality
FIELD.NAME: vitality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An indication of whether a dwc:Organism was alive or dead at the time of collection or observation. Example: alive

FIELD.LABEL: Water Body
FIELD.NAME: waterBody
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the water body in which the dcterms:Location occurs. Example: Indian Ocean

FIELD.LABEL: Material Sample ID
FIELD.NAME: materialSampleID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier for the dwc:MaterialSample (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:MaterialSample). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:materialSampleID globally unique. Example: 06809dc5-f143-459a-be1a-6f03e63fc083
